><OLD>
>
> Tucson Prime continues on his path, and keeps at a good but safe=
 speed through the tunnel. He knew that going too fast could upset the stru=
cture even weaken it to the point of breaking, which he did not want to do.=
 He continues steadilly, sensing that Vestige was growing weak once more. G=
ently, he begins to take control of his own wheel, and goes in the directio=
n of where he's being led.
>
> "It's all right old friend, you have given m=
e the course, I can take it from here. Rest now. I promise we will reach th=
e chamber in time for you to be repaired."
>
> With each word Tucson speaks=
, his voice changes ever so slightly, sounding more and more like Optimus P=
rime. Still he himself has no idea that he was ever related to the great Au=
tobot leader. All he knew is that he admired him greatly not only as his co=
mmander, but as a mentor during his younger years as a rookie Autobot. Tucs=
on could now sense some changes within himself, not only on the outside, bu=
t on the inside as well. He could have turned to fight whatever onslaught w=
as following him, yet he chose not to, and chose to save a life over taking=
 one. It was a choice he felt very good about and had no regrets to his dec=
ision.

<NEW>

As Tuscon moved foward the trip was fairly easy at first. Th=
e walls
and floor were smooth and well made. The halls, while somewhat dim
=
were still well lit, especially with the help of his headlights. And
while =
weak Vesitge still tried to hold on, slightly guiding Tuscon via
the sterri=
ng wheel to tell him which turns to make and how fast to go.

However as ti=
me went on it was easy to see that Vestige was still
slipping away, his hol=
d on the wheel becoming more and more slack as
time went on. Also the stran=
ge things is that the walls and floor were
changing with distance as well. =
The metal deckplating was becoming
rougher and rougher, going from the silv=
er and grey of metal to the
brown and blacks of something strange almost ch=
itinous or shell like.
The walls began to take on a decidely dark brown cas=
t, and instead of
thier smooth gleaming surface they began to get rough and=
 jagged,
almost like claws and thorns that sometimes forced Tuscon to slow =
down
to navigate around them.

Outside the vehicle the ominous buzzing soun=
d was getting louder and
louder as Tuscon moved foward, while inside his ca=
b Vestige weakly
gestured and tried to help. The tunnel straightened as Tus=
con drove,
but it had also gotten steadily darker and more dangerous, the g=
round
beneath him now feeling more like earth and stone than metal. However=

ahead of him he could see a gleaming light. It was as if a door
suddenly o=
pened at the end of a long hall and a light that beckoned
Tuscon towards it=
, but if it was to victory or destruction it was
difficult to tell.

Outsid=
e Tuscon could hear comming from the direction of the light the
clear voice=
 of Rodimus, "I AM HERE! DRIVE TUSCON! DRIVE!"

Meanwhile Inside Tuscon's c=
ab Vestige slumped over, even as several
large insect-spider like creatures=
 seem to melt out from the darkness
in front of the door and stand guard ov=
er it.

"We are the horde, and you will go no further!!" The creatures rush=

foward to attack!

(TAG)
